original_solution_mapping.L1: Cornelia visited 42 countries - 20 countries - 10 countries = <<42-20-10=12>>12 countries which were outside of Europe and South America.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Half of those 12 countries were in Asia, so there were 12 countries / 2 = <<12/2=6>>6 Asian countries that Cornelia visited.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 3616.
    Returns: the number of Asian countries Cornelia visited.
    """
    # L1
    total_countries = 42 # visited already 42 different countries
    europe_countries = 20 # 20 of them were in Europe
    south_america_countries = 10 # and 10 in South America
    remaining_countries = total_countries - europe_countries - south_america_countries

    # L2
    half_divisor = 2 # only half of them were in Asia
    asian_countries = remaining_countries / half_divisor

    # FA
    answer = asian_countries
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Cornelia visited {total_countries} countries - {europe_countries} countries - {south_america_countries} countries = <<{total_countries}-{europe_countries}-{south_america_countries}={remaining_countries}>>{remaining_countries} countries which were outside of Europe and South America.

Half of those {remaining_countries} countries were in Asia, so there were {remaining_countries} countries / {half_divisor} = <<{remaining_countries}/{half_divisor}={asian_countries}>>{asian_countries} Asian countries that Cornelia visited.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Cornelia visited 42 countries - 20 countries - 10 countries = <<42-20-10=12>>12 countries which were outside of Europe and South America.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Half of those 2 countries were in Asia, so there were 2 countries / 2 = <<2/2=1>>1 Asian countries that Cornelia visited.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'half_divisor' (value: 2) was used instead of 'remaining_countries' (value: 12).
